alert.note: Alert for Wilson; Woodson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 03 at 7:06PM CDT until July 03 at 11:15PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wichita has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Wilson County in southeastern Kansas... Eastern Woodson County in southeastern Kansas... * Until 1115 PM CDT. * At 706 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing very heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area through 9 PM. Flash flooding is likely. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks, streams, streets, rural roads, highways, and underpasses. * Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Neodesha, Fredonia, Yates Center, Altoona, Buffalo, Neosho Falls, Benedict, Rose and Piqua. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown.
